alert.note: Alert for Franklin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:21AM EST until January 12 at 8:24AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Louisburg affecting Franklin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Louisburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Banks overflow at Main Street. River Bend Park is flooded and storm drains are inundated along the river. At 22.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Flooding begins in Pruitt and Shannon Villages on the east side of town. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tar River Louisbur 20.0 20.9 Thu 8 am EST 16.7 10.8 10.1 8.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 830 PM EST.
